alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 9:46PM EST until December 24 at 6:49AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of East Central and North Central Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 946 PM EST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain and snowmelt. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Millinocket, Greenville, Patten, Ripogenus, Mount Katahdin, East Millinocket, Medway, Monson, Mount Chase, Blanchard, White Cap Mountain, Baxter State Park, Frenchtown, Kokadjo, South Branch Pond, Lobster Township, Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Chesuncook, Lobster Lake and Northeast Carry. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
